sentence.Network_en: He has been scathing in his denunciation of corrupt and incompetent politicians.
sentence.Network_cn: 他抨击起那些腐败无能的政客来一直都很尖刻犀利。

sentence.Network_en: The denunciation was made on the basis of second-hand information.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些指责是依据二手信息提出的。

sentence.Network_en: an angry denunciation of the government's policies

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin denuntiatio(n-), from the verb denuntiare (see denounce). The original sense was 'public announcement', also 'formal accusation or charge'; the main sense dates from the mid 19th cent

entry.def: Denunciation of someone or something is severe public criticism of them.

example.ex: On September 24, he wrote a stinging denunciation of his critics...
example.tran: 9月24号，他写了一篇痛斥那些批评者的措词强烈的文章。

example.ex: He has been scathing in his denunciation of corrupt and incompetent politicians.
example.tran: 他抨击起那些腐败无能的政客来一直都很尖刻犀利。

entry.def: Denunciation is the act of reporting someone who has broken a rule or law to the authorities.

example.ex: ...the denunciation of Jews to the Nazis during the Second World War.
example.tran: 第二次世界大战期间向纳粹分子告发犹太人

auth_sentence.content: Ignorance, cowardice, betrayal, denunciation is the norm.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ignorance, cowardice, betrayal, denunciation is the norm.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ignorance, cowardice, betrayal, denunciation is the norm.

auth_sentence.content: Why...a denunciation of war ought always to precede the actual commencement of hostilities.
auth_sentence.res_content: Why...a denunciation of war ought always to precede the actual commencement of hostilities.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Why...a denunciation of war ought always to precede the actual commencement of hostilities.

auth_sentence.content: He was given a denunciation, a list of names, to sign.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was given a denunciation, a list of names, to sign.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was given a denunciation, a list of names, to sign.

means.word_mean: 公开的谴责; 斥责; 指责 (~ of sb/sth)

sentences.en: We were amazed to hear the witness’s denunciation of the accused.
sentences.cn: 听了证人对被告的指责,我们大为惊異。

sentences.en: An  angry denunciation of the government's policies.
